page.title: 09POLLARD'S MONSTER - 1
page.content: Pollard's land (part of which is the site of Barrington school) was aquired as the result of Pollard slaying a 'monstrous boar or serpent'. In early times the hills and denes were thick and dense with many wild animals. Local people feared them and the monster had killed several villagers and knights. Both the King and the Bishop offered rewards to get rid of the 'dreadful monster'. Pollard, the long looked for champion, tracked the beast to its lair in Etherly Dene and climbing a large Beech tree waited, knowing that the tree was its favorite delicacy. After the Beast had gorged itself Pollard mounted a fierce attack. The combat waged 'long and deadly' and the sun had set before he could sever the beast's head. He cut out the tongue placed it in his wallet and slept.
